image.altText: SA Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia.

props.synopsis: Even as the tide turned for the last SA government, Vincent Tarzia's star remained ascendant. The new SA Liberal leader's political rise began a decade ago, and his career has included stints as speaker and as a minister.

title.children: Who is new SA Opposition Leader Vincent Tarzia?

image.altText: A man and a woman hold up grocery items in front of a yellow truck

props.synopsis: A free grocery store offering an array of produce and pantry staples opens its doors in Adelaide today in a bid to tackle the rising demand for food as the cost of living bites more South Australians.

title.children: 'Care, respect and dignity' as first free supermarket offering 'rescued' items opens in Adelaide

image.altText: Albanese walks and looks serious on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: Laws to restrict gambling advertising are being bargained over inside Labor's caucus, as the prime minister warns a misstep could have "unintended consequences" for Australia.

title.children: Government bargains to win over Labor MPs on laws to ban gambling ads around children's programs and live sport

image.altText: charred helicopter wreckage lifted from hotel roof

props.synopsis: Investigators will return to the DoubleTree hotel on Cairns Esplanade today as they probe what happened before the allegedly stolen craft crashed.

title.children: Wreck of fatal helicopter crash lifted from Cairns hotel roof as investigators return to probe 'unauthorised flight'

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a teenage school girl leaning against the lockers on her phone.

props.synopsis: A plan for venues, such as pubs and hotels, to verify someone's identity through a QR code will be unveiled today by Bill Shorten. Follow live.Â

title.children: Plan to allow Aussies to use QR codes to verify ID

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A digital thumbs up to replace ID checks

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a stage

props.synopsis: Once a Democratic stronghold, Wisconsin flipped for Trump in 2016. Now, both Republicans and Democrats are scrambling for votes in America's "dairyland", convinced the 2024 race might be decided there.

title.children: To beat Trump, Harris will likely need this small state. Here's how she and Walz are faring in Wisconsin

image.altText: Crowd of people on the streets of Sydney

props.synopsis: Whatever way you try to split it, the generational divide between millennials and baby boomers is growing â and it's our Australian obsession with owning property that is widening the gap, and interest rates that are keeping it that way.

title.children: Why interest rates and real estate are behind our growing generational divide

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab and long dress stands next to a window in a corridor with her hand on the window sill

props.synopsis: People from southern Lebanon have had to flee the daily air strikes on their villages, and for months have stayed in derelict hotels-turned-shelters.

title.children: 'Get us back to our homes or take us to another country': Displaced Lebanese fear a broader war with Israel

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: A young man charged over a life-threatening single-punch attack at Adelaide's nightclub strip early on Sunday has asked a court to release him on home detention bail.

title.children: One-punch assault victim on life support as alleged attacker seeks bail

image.altText: A man in a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: NBL side the Adelaide 36ers sack coach Scott Ninnis less than two months out of the 2024-25 NBL season, and announce he will replaced by American assistant coach Mike Wells.

title.children: Adelaide 36ers coach sacked six months after signing two-year contract

image.altText: Christine Gwin travelled to Mumbai for dental work

props.synopsis: An Indian dental clinic which markets cut-price services to Australians has been accused of using fake online reviews and price gouging â leaving one woman in pain after she travelled to the subcontinent for care.

title.children: The Australian woman in 'constant pain' after travelling to India for cheaper dental work

image.altText: A professional photo of a man with a beard in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered a probe into nepotism allegations against a senior executive of the Queensland Public Trustee whose son was employed and promoted by the agency.

title.children: Nepotism complaint alleges 'preferential treatment' in hiring of Public Trustee executive's son

image.altText: A man in a checquered shirt holds a heavy hose as another man sprays a large fire

props.synopsis: Greece is on fire watch as high temperatures and dangerous weather conditions fan a dangerous wildfire near the capital.

title.children: Wildfire with flames as high as 25 metres rages near Athens

image.altText: A photo of a man in a lab.

props.synopsis: More than two dozen lab tests have been unable to diagnose long COVID, according to new research which suggests there may be no reliable way to diagnose the condition.

title.children: There is no single test to diagnose long COVID patients, international researchers say

image.altText: A hand holding a microphone. Foam on top of the microphone has '7 News' on it.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has spoken to more than 200 people to investigate allegations of Channel Seven's toxic culture, uncovering allegations of bullying, sexism, and exploitation.

title.children: 'This was a tool, a tactic': When Channel 7 staff complained, management had HR turn on them

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is expected to begin today flat after a mixed day on US and global markets. Rising geopolitical risk is pushing energy prices higher. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX to open flat after mixed day on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX to open flat as Wall Street shows mixed start to week

image.altText: A character stands next to a video game depiction of red and yellow post boxes

props.synopsis: Will Australia's next iconic artwork be a game? As the industry matures, a growing suite of Aussie game developers is helping players explore never-before-seen regions and communities â¦ and make some uncomfortable choices.

title.children: Would you recognise your home in a video game? Press A to visit Australia

image.altText: Close up of a hand holding glass under a streaming tap, above a kitchen sink. The glass is full of clear water.

props.synopsis: In April the American environmental protection agency announced there is no safe level of so-called "forever chemicals" in drinking water and set enforceable limits across the country. Australian experts are asking why we're not doing the same.

title.children: 'An international embarrassment': Australia criticised for lagging behind US, EU on drinking water standards

image.altText: A glum family sits outside tents with two children blowing bubbles

props.synopsis: Kyiv now controls 1,000 square kilometres of Russian land, Ukraine's top commander said, as they continue its largest cross-border attack in almost two-and-a-half years of full-scale war.

title.children: Putin says 'the enemy will certainly receive a worthy response' as Ukraine says it controls 1,000 square km of Russian land

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: The Victorian government plans to introduce laws blocking anyone seeking to sue Victoria Police in relation to the disastrous Lawyer X affair.

title.children: Victorian government moves to block people from suing police over Lawyer X debacle

image.altText: Two women athletes compete during a wrestling event in the Olympics

props.synopsis: The IOC says it has "double-digit" number of cities or countries in talks about their interest in hosting a future Summer Games.

title.children: Istanbul, India â¦ Indonesia? Asian cities and nations jostle to host Olympics in 2036

image.altText: A male splendid fairywren stands in dappled light with a sunbeam lighting its head.

props.synopsis: They may seem like just a beautiful blue bird, but under the surface the social dynamics of the splendid fairy-wren is anything but simple.

title.children: 'Like watching a soap opera': the hidden lives of splendid fairy-wrens

image.altText: Two people enjoy movie with drinks and popcorn.

props.synopsis: There are fewer theatres to visit in the country these days, but operators say they are still pulling in punters.

title.children: Cinemas still popular as $12 beers become the norm in cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Graham Thorpe pictured while coaching for England

props.synopsis: The family of recently-deceased English cricket great Graham Thorpe has revealed he took his own life after a lengthy battle with depression and anxiety despite trying "many, many treatments".

title.children: 'Can affect anyone': Graham Thorpe's wife reveals late English cricket great suffered from depression and anxiety

image.altText: A marle statue of three headless female figures, standing nude, side by side, with arms on one another.

props.synopsis: From the influence of the devil to overzealous restorers, there are numerous strange reasons and theories behind the conspicuous lack of pubic hair on women depicted in Western art.

title.children: The nude female body has been depicted in art countless times. But where is all the pubic hair?

image.altText: man in orange shirt and floppy hat smiling in front of tractor

props.synopsis: Sam Hughes had a gap year idea that turned into an epic adventure. He spent three years travelling on a tractor around the country and raised $260,000 for three rural charities.

title.children: Why this 21yo spent three years on a tractor trek around Australia

image.altText: a beach with a rocky cove in the foreground

props.synopsis: Huge swells move tonnes of sand from the northern end of the eastern suburbs beach, but the new feature will only be there for a couple of months according to lifeguards.

title.children: Freshly uncovered cove at Sydney beach attracts visitors, human and seal, but comes with a warning

image.altText: A lit up taxi sign next to a hand holding phone with Uber sign

props.synopsis: While the taxi industry has taken steps to modernise â including a burgeoning partnership with its main competitors â there are signs it's still grappling to meet the needs of the market.

title.children: 12 years after Uber's arrival, there are signs the taxi industry is still struggling to stay competitive

image.altText: a crowd watches a group play a card game

props.synopsis: A Chinese state-backed newspaper urges people to stop playing a popular card game, arguing it is addictive and distracting people from their work.Â

title.children: Chinese media denounce card game enjoyed by Communist Party officials

image.altText: Imane Khelif poses with her medal after returning to Algeria

props.synopsis: Imane Khelif has been showered with love and adoration upon returning to her home country as an Olympic gold medallist after a Games filled with controversy.

title.children: 'A dream I had for eight years': Imane Khelif returns to Algeria to a hero's welcome after claiming Olympic gold medal

image.altText: Middle-aged woman with fair hair wearing dark jacket walking in front of beige wall.

props.synopsis: The former head of WA's youth detention system acknowledges some information in communications produced before and after the opening of the notorious Unit 18 was inaccurate and, in one case, contained a lie. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Unit 18 inquest hears former boss has 'no explanation' for lie in promotional video

image.altText: A young man with Down's syndrome in a black t-shirt dances in front of a brick ruin and a grey sky

props.synopsis:
When Rewards for the Tribe, a new work performed by a troupe of dancers with and without disability, went on tour, director Rhys Graham was there to document it.

Â

title.children: New Australian dance doco explores what perfection is and whether we should strive for it at all

image.altText: Marles US UK signing AUKUS document

props.synopsis: A revamped version of the AUKUS agreement includes indemnity for the US and UK against radioactive waste accidents and lets them walk away with one year's notice.

title.children: AUKUS deal would allow US and UK to walk away, with Australia to cover risk of loss or injury
